basics.description: **Note:** Please refer to the following before installing the solution: • Review the solution [Release Notes](https://github.com/Azure/Azure-Sentinel/tree/master/Solutions/Corelight/ReleaseNotes.md) • There may be [known issues](https://aka.ms/sentinelsolutionsknownissues) pertaining to this Solution, please refer to them before installing. The [Corelight](https://corelight.com/) solution provides the capability to ingest events from [Zeek](https://zeek.org/) and [Suricata](https://suricata.io/) via Corelight Sensors into Microsoft Sentinel. **Underlying Microsoft Technologies used:** This solution takes a dependency on the following technologies, and some of these dependencies either may be in [Preview](https://azure.microsoft.com/support/legal/preview-supplemental-terms/) state or might result in additional ingestion or operational costs: a. [Agent based logs collection from Windows and Linux machines](https://docs.microsoft.com/azure/azure-monitor/agents/data-sources-custom-logs) **Data Connectors:** 1, **Parsers:** 108, **Workbooks:** 1, **Analytic Rules:** 10, **Hunting Queries:** 10 [Learn more about Microsoft Sentinel](https://aka.ms/azuresentinel) | [Learn more about Solutions](https://aka.ms/azuresentinelsolutionsdoc)

options.text: This Solution installs the data connector for Corelight. You can get Corelight custom log data in your Microsoft Sentinel workspace. After installing the solution, configure and enable this data connector by following guidance in Manage solution view.

The Solution installs a parser that transforms the ingested data into Microsoft Sentinel normalized format. The normalized format enables better correlation of different types of data from different data sources to drive end-to-end outcomes seamlessly in security monitoring, hunting, incident investigation and response scenarios in Microsoft Sentinel.

link.label: Learn more about connecting data sources

options.text: This solution installs workbook(s) to help you gain insights into the telemetry collected in Microsoft Sentinel. After installing the solution, start using the workbook in Manage solution view.
Sets the time name for analysis
This solution installs the following analytic rule templates. After installing the solution, create and enable analytic rules in Manage solution view.

elements.name: analytic1
elements.label: Corelight - C2 DGA Detected Via Repetitive Failures

options.text: Detects large amounts of DNS resolution failures.
Detects external proxy usage.
Detects SMB requests that originate internally and communicate with an external IP address.

elements.name: analytic4
elements.label: Corelight - Multiple Compressed Files Transferred over HTTP

options.text: Detects compressed archives transferre over HTTP.

elements.name: analytic5
elements.label: Corelight - Multiple files sent over HTTP with abnormal requests

options.text: Detects sources sending multiple compressed files greater than 10MBs sent over HTTP in a short amount of time.

elements.name: analytic6
elements.label: Corelight - Network Service Scanning Multiple IP Addresses

options.text: Identify scanning of services that may be available on the internal network.
Detects post requests to unusual extensions.

elements.name: analytic8
elements.label: Corelight - Possible Webshell (Rare PUT or POST)

options.text: Detects rare post requests to a single webserver location.

elements.name: analytic9
elements.label: Corelight - SMTP Email containing NON Ascii Characters within the Subject

options.text: Detects where an emails contain non ascii characters within the Subject.

elements.name: analytic10
elements.label: Corelight - Possible Typo Squatting or Punycode Phishing HTTP Request

options.text: Detects when an HTTP request was made to a domain that was using unicode/punycode.
This solution installs the following hunting queries. After installing the solution, run these hunting queries to hunt for threats in Manage solution view.
Query searches for emails with NON-Ascii characters within the Subject . This hunting query depends on Corelight data connector (Corelight_v2_smtp corelight_smtp Parser or Table)

elements.name: huntingquery2
elements.label: Corelight - Compressed Files Transferred over HTTP

options.text: Query searches for top sources which transferred compressed archives over HTTP. This hunting query depends on Corelight data connector (Corelight_v2_http corelight_http Parser or Table)

elements.name: huntingquery3
elements.label: Corelight - Top sources of data transferred

options.text: Query searches for top sources by transferred data over period of time. This hunting query depends on Corelight data connector (Corelight_v2_http corelight_http Parser or Table)
Query searches for external facing services. This hunting query depends on Corelight data connector (Corelight_v2_conn corelight_conn Parser or Table)

Query searches for files which where seen in logs over period of time. This hunting query depends on Corelight data connector (Corelight_v2_files Corelight_v2_conn corelight_files corelight_conn Parser or Table)
Query searches for files uploaded over period of time by each source. This hunting query depends on Corelight data connector (Corelight_v2_http corelight_http Parser or Table)

elements.name: huntingquery7
elements.label: Corelight - Multiple Remote SMB Connections from single client

options.text: Detects when a single source is connecting to many different SMB or file shares. This hunting query depends on Corelight data connector (Corelight_v2_smb_mapping corelight_smb_mapping Parser or Table)
Query searches for downloaded obfuscated binary file names. This hunting query depends on Corelight data connector (Corelight_v2_http corelight_http Parser or Table)
Query searches for rare post requests to a single location. This hunting query depends on Corelight data connector (Corelight_v2_http corelight_http Parser or Table)
Query searches for repetitive DNS resolution failures from single host. This hunting query depends on Corelight data connector (Corelight_v2_dns corelight_dns Parser or Table)
